body_content.explanation: abbreviation for run batted in: in baseball, a run (= point) that is scored when the batter hits the ball in a way that allows another player on their team to reach home plate (= the last place they have to touch to score), and which is counted to describe how successful the batter is:
examples: He had nine home runs and 23 RBIs.
He ended the season three RBI short of the club record.
